pullRequest.title: issue #1480 - introduce new fhir-server-config security group and use
pullRequest.bodyText:
combine our existing "oauth" and "authFilter" fhir-server-config property groups into a single new group called "security".


introduce new properties like:

fhirServer/security/basic (enabled by default)
fhirServer/security/cert (enabled by default)
fhirServer/security/smart (disabled by default, with customizable endpoints and scopes)
fhirServer/security/cors (default=true)



use these values to populate CapabilityStatement.rest.security

only serve up the Oauth extensions in the CapabilityStatement when fhirServer/security/service is set to OAuth or SMART-on-FHIR



only serve up the .well-known/smart-capabilities endpoint when fhirServer/security/service is set to SMART-on-FHIR


Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant lmsurpre@us.ibm.com

commit.message:
issue #1480 - introduce new fhir-server-config security group and use

1. combine our existing "oauth" and "authFilter" fhir-server-config property groups into a single new group called "security".

2. introduce new properties like:
    * fhirServer/security/basic (enabled by default)
    * fhirServer/security/cert (enabled by default)
    * fhirServer/security/smart (disabled by default, with customizable endpoints and scopes)
    * fhirServer/security/cors (default=true)

3. use these values to populate `CapabilityStatement.rest.security`
    * only serve up the Oauth extensions in the CapabilityStatement when fhirServer/security/service is set to `OAuth` or `SMART-on-FHIR`

4. only serve up the `.well-known/smart-capabilities` endpoint when fhirServer/security/service is set to `SMART-on-FHIR`

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

commit.message:
work around flaky search test

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: not related to the other changes, but thought I might as well include it anyway

commit.message:
move smart config underneath the oauth config

SMART is really a profile of oauth; this make that relationship more
clear

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

flip default value of basic and cert enabled properties to false

follow the precedent of the notification config:
* if the "enabled" field is not included in the config file, then it is
not enabled
* include the corresponding config groups in our default config; Basic
and Certificates security groups are set to true to match the default
server behavior

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: If we require at least one auth mechanism to be selected, maybe adding a comment here to highlight it in the security block/json object

I don't think this is a best practice.
We should probably limit to localhost or externalize the variable.
I'm not sure about the wildcard here, I think it's a-ok to have '*'
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -99,6 +99,12 @@
     </dataSource>
 
     <webAppSecurity allowFailOverToBasicAuth="true" singleSignonEnabled="false"/>
+    
+    <cors domain="/"
+        allowedOrigins="*"
+        allowedMethods="GET, DELETE, POST, PUT, HEAD"
+        allowedHeaders="*"

nodes.bodyText: confirmation, if OAuth doesn't exist, we don't add and advertise?
does this deserve a backlog issue?

+        if (supportedScopes != null && !supportedScopes.isEmpty()) {
+            responseBuilder.add("scopes_supported", Json.createArrayBuilder(supportedScopes).build()); // recommended

commit.message:
introduce properties for adding the additional "recommended" fields

also reordered things to match order used in
http://hl7.org/fhir/smart-app-launch/StructureDefinition-oauth-uris.html
and http://hl7.org/fhir/smart-app-launch/conformance/index.html#declaring-support-for-oauth2-endpoints
Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>
